benchmark_details.name: A Benchmark of Speculative Decoding for Efficient LLM Test-Time Scaling
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces the first comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate speculative decoding methods for accelerating large language model (LLM) test-time scaling in order to mitigate computational overhead.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic evaluation of speculative decoding methods for accelerating LLM test-time scaling.

data.annotation: Official problems from mathematical competitions and expert-level questions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated during experiments comparing speculative decoding methods under Best-of-N sampling and multi-round thinking.
methodology.interpretation: Higher speedup ratio indicates improved efficiency in reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Key Baselines include Model-based SpS, Training-based EAGLE-3, and various N-gram methods.
methodology.validation: Evaluation methods utilized fair experimental protocols defined in the benchmark.
